wikipedia_page.main: Gerald Henry Blake is a retired British academic and geographer. He is Professor Emeritus of Geography at Durham University. He was Principal of Collingwood College, Durham from 1987 to 2001.He attended Monkton Combe School from 1949 to 1954. A former student of St Edmund Hall, Oxford, Blake was appointed Professor of Geography in 1995.

response: * Professor Gerald Blake, 1936-, Professor Emeritus of Geography at Durham University and former Principal of Collingwood College, Durham
* Gerald Blake – Geographer and Principal of Collingwood College (1987–2001)

In 1999 he earned a doctorate in Political Geography from the same university, under the supervision of Professor Ewan Anderson and Professor Gerald Blake. As part of his PhD Ian became a published author through his “Malta: Macro Political Threats” Geo Journal.
